meanings.definition: The activity of watching and noting the numbers and types of trains passing by.
meanings.sent1: Trainspotting can be a relaxing hobby for those who enjoy observing trains.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of enthusiasts trainspotting at the station yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The trainspotting club had a competition to see who could spot the most trains in a day.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for trainspotting was like a never-ending adventure through the railway world.
meanings.sent5: The art of trainspotting involves patience and a keen eye for detail.

meanings.definition: The title of a novel and film by Irvine Welsh, depicting the lives of heroin addicts in Edinburgh.
meanings.sent1: Have you read Trainspotting by Irvine Welsh? It's a gripping story.
meanings.sent2: Trainspotting is considered a cult classic in the world of literature and cinema.
meanings.sent3: The book Trainspotting offers a raw and honest portrayal of addiction in society.
meanings.sent4: The film adaptation of Trainspotting captures the gritty reality of life on the streets.
meanings.sent5: Trainspotting explores the dark and harrowing world of drug addiction with unflinching honesty.
